intro: Erigeron thunbergii f. haruoi, commonly known as the Japanese blueweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its blue to purple daisy-like flowers and silver-blue foliage, which provide ornamental value in gardens. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is native to Japan and is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ease of care. The inflorescence consists of a central yellow disk surrounded by white to blue ray florets.
